intro: Sabia heterosepala, commonly known as the African violet. It is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments. Its leaves are typically thick and waxy, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant colors and compact size.
